snippet: Gov. Jerry Brown, who is ordering California agencies to move quickly to resolve the long-running issue, has drawn criticism for not responding faster.
abstract: California Gov Jerry Brown declares state of emergency in Porter Ranch neighborhood of Los Angeles, where natural gas well owned by Southern California Gas Comapny has been leaking toxic fumes into air since late October, sickening residents and prompting evacuations; emergency declaration comes in response to prolonged nature of leak; residents express frustration over delays.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Jerry Brown, who is ordering California agencies to move quickly to resolve the long-running issue, has drawn criticism for not responding faster.

headline.main: Governor Declares Emergency Over Los Angeles Gas Leak
headline.print_headline: Emergency Declared in California Over October Methane Leak
